And when you pay for m2 of heating, not as a flat but as a whole building, energy costs is divided by m2 for each flat. So you will pay a metric fuckton of money. Get a flat in a renovated house, or newly built one, you will pay \~100 Euros/month for everything + rent.

Ive had been living for some time in senamiestis 3 floor apartment of 63sqm or so, it seemed always not that warm and i kept the heating on all the time. I learned to asjust that manually when i dont need the heat that much after getting a monthly bill of around 300 euros.

You did not mention how much is the bill or broke it down! So I have no clue what to say about it. However, you should be very aware before renting that the bills are supper important factor to consider, type of building, type of heating, Insulation, does the son reach the place, is there high administration fees.
